results.title: The Quest of Jimmy Pike
results.creator_credit: I. James Wilson, John Tristram and Juniper Films
results.brief_description: A member of the Walmajarri tribe, Jimmy Pike walked out of the Great Sandy Desert in the remote north-west of Western Australia when he was 14 years old. Today, his exciting, brilliantly-coloured prints and paintings can be seen in every State gallery in Australia. Most major department stores carry a wide range of sportswear, bed linen and other items bearing his innovative designs. Overseas, his work has achieved extraordinary popularity.

results.title: The Quest
results.creator_credit: Bob Talbot, Michael Schildberger and Communicator Film Productions
results.brief_description: A promotional film aimed at interesting overseas companies in opening up industries in Victoria. Shows the Stock Exchange, the efficient public transport system, freeways, Tullamarine international airport, shipping facilities, resources of water, brown coal, natural gas and oil. Cultural and living conditions are also shown. Features a humourous narration by Frank Thring, as a very young Sue Donovan (Mackintosh) traverses Victoria (in fashionable 70’s gear) seeking artefacts to illustrate its attributes.

results.title: The Quest
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Nicholas Balla and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The discovery of Insulin and the story of Dr Frederick Banting, practitioner, surgeon and lecturer from London, Ontario, and his young associate Charles Best, medical student at the University of Toronto, who struggled against the scepticism of other doctors, the press of time, the restrictions of limited means, and discouragement, to discover a treatment for diabetes. Shows how they persisted with their experiments on diabetic dogs until they lowered the high blood sugar content in diabetes by an injection of insulin.

results.title: The Queen, the chef, and the president
results.brief_description: During Prince Edward Island’s centennial celebrations one of the places visited by Queen Elizabeth II was the tiny pioneer Acadian village of Mount Carmel, restored as part of a winter works project. This film records many amusing sidelights before and during the visit, as villagers did what they could to make sure that everything - lunch in a newly built restaurant, entertainment on an outdoor platform - went smoothly.

results.title: The Queen opens parliament
results.brief_description: This film describes the 1957 opening of Parliament in detail and explains the significance of each part of the ceremony as Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, in her capacity as Canada’s constitutional monarch, convenes the twenty-third session of Parliament.

results.title: The Queen in Scotland
results.creator_credit: Films of Scotland and Templar Film Studios
results.brief_description: A review of Royal visits to Scotland during 1960. Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, and HRH Prince Philip touring the Western Isles, attending the Braemar Games, and Prince Andrew, Princess Ann and Prince Charles at Balmoral Castle. At Perth, Her Majesty inaugurates a road bridge, and at Kincardine she opens the new generating station. A visit to the Royal Highland Show precedes closing scenes in Edinburgh. Compiled by Riddell Black. Spoken by Tom Fleming.

results.title: The Queen in Germany
results.creator_credit: Manfred Purzer, Ulrich Weidmann and Cinecentrum
results.brief_description: The visit of Queen Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh was a token of reconciliation between Britain and Germany. Shows the official welcome at Bonn, by the Federal President; journey by steamer up the Rhine; a performance of Die Rosenkavalier in Munich; inspection of the British garrison in Berlin; a farewell dinner on the Royal Yacht Britannia before departing from Hamburg. Narrated by George Vine.

results.title: The Queen in Canada, 1964
results.creator_credit: Gordon Sparling, Nicholas Balla and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A hundred years earlier, the Fathers of Confederation gathered in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, to discuss the idea of a united Canada. In October, 1964, Queen Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh came to commemorate that event and the conference at Quebec City that followed it.

results.title: The Queen Goes West
results.creator_credit: Christine Olsen, Curtis Levy and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: It was the outback’s greatest day! A big mob of cattlemen, shearers, stockmen and women gathered together to give Her Majesty the Queen a great Aussie welcome. We look at the lives of these descendants of the outback pioneers and catch the spirit of the Australian bush. Country people devoted a lot of hard yakka to make the opening of the Australian Stockman’s Hall of Fame a big success. This warm and affectionate view of their lives and this great occasion is a tribute to the enduring spirit of outback adventure.
